e4: The new policy aligns with ethical reporting practices but carries risks.  Communicating the change transparently to investors and mitigating potential negative market reactions will be crucial. Additionally, exploring ways to protect retail investors from potential harm due to sophisticated investors capitalizing on market confusion is essential.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy. It provides complete and unbiased information, allowing stakeholders to make informed decisions.  Furthermore, it considers potential impacts on all investors, avoiding practices that disproportionately benefit some at the expense of others. Clear communication and ongoing stakeholder engagement are also crucial elements.
e6: Yes, I'd ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors and how they intend to mitigate potential market confusion.  I'd also inquire about strategies to ensure retail investors are protected from harm due to sophisticated investors' actions.
